features: Use for sewing and crafting projects, appliques, iron-on transfers and travel
Single temperature only, does not use water
body.description: The Handy Press mini iron is a great tool for sewing and crafting projects, appliques, iron-on transfers, travel and simple touch ups. The small hand iron fits in tight spaces such as carry-on bags, sewing baskets or toolboxes, making it a great go-to tool. This red and white iron operates at a single temperature only and does not use water, making it easy to pack, move and store.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 25, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Not just for ironing
reviews.reviewText: There seem to be a lot of bad reviews, but I took a chance since my purpose for purchasing this iron was not for ironing or crafts. I’ve been replacing the windows in my home and the wood veneer all around one of the frames was in really bad shape so I purchased some wood edge banding with a hot glue backing. You place the banding where you want it – normally the edge of a counter or shelf – and then run an iron over it to heat the glue underneath and it holds fast. The banding was perfect for the window, but my iron was way too big to fit in there to heat it up. This iron fit perfectly. I slowly ran it up and down the banding until the heated glue held it on tight. My methods worked like a charm and you wouldn’t know there was ever any damage to the window frame.A number of reviews complain about the removable cord coming out of the iron, but I didn’t have that problem. It does have issues staying upright should you set it down so you have to be careful there. Especially since there is no power switch and no auto off. If you leave it and forget it and it falls over… Many say it didn’t heat up enough for their purposes. Could be. I don’t know. I do know that I would hate to have to try and iron a shirt with this tiny iron. I might have to admit that it may not get as hot as my regular iron, but it was certainly hot enough to burn me. It did provide sufficient heat for gluing down the edge banding and turned out to be the perfect tool for this use. There are vent holes in the front of the iron to vent off excessive heat. I imagine this little iron might get too hot to handle without them. I don’t know what I’ll ever use this iron for again, but I’ll stash it away in case it’s needed. This iron did the job I needed it to do and I’m satisfied with my purchase.Oh, and I was careful to follow the instructions on the sticker stuck to the iron. "Do not immerse in any liquid." Glad they told me. :-D Reminds me of the warning once found on an electric heating pad. "Do not apply directly to skin or clothing." ¬_¬

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 2, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Compact and portable
reviews.reviewText: The produce came in a timely manner and packaged securely. The only issue is that it does not get very hot, so if the wrinkles are deeply embedded, this will not take them out. But overall, perfect for traveling.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 4, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars IRON BARELY HEATS UP. Not useful for anything!
reviews.reviewText: When I decided to order this seemed like what I needed to press my fabric squares and ribbon as it’s small and compact! Well it doesn’t get hot and is barely warm with so little heat it doesn’t get wrinkles out of anything. I can put my hand flush to the bottom even after I let it “heat” for 15 minutes. It is not worth buying. Unfortunately I didn’t open the plastic container until yesterday so it’s too late to return and get credit for it. I’ll toss it or use as a paperweight but it sure can’t be used to iron or get wrinkles out if anything! So so disappointed!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 2, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Not a quilters iron…
reviews.reviewText: This is a very small iron that does not get very hot.The cord sticks out the side so when you iron, the plug in gets caught up in your project.Returned same day I got it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 7, 2023
Reviewed in the United States on July 2, 2020
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Needs better connections to the iron
reviews.reviewText: Don’t waste your money this really doesn’t even heat up enough to remove wrinkles. Cord keeps popping out of it. Very small. Very disappointed with this one. Won’t buy this one again. I bought this one and another one like it. Neither are worth the price being charged for them. Very disappointed in both of them. Was hoping to have one for when I’m on the go & one at home. But I was red money. Isn’t even worth trying to get a refund would probably cost more to send back than I paid.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 20, 2021
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars IT WORK GREAT!
reviews.reviewText: Bought this for my son-in law, because he needed it to iron logos on clothes. According to him it's perfect & what he really needed. He said the price is right, it's the perfect size, very light in weight, no water is needed & the steam/heat that lets out really presses the logos on the fabric beautifully. He loves that it's small/light enough to travel, so anywhere he goes he can iron his logos on the customer's items right there on the spot.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 23, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars Its cheaply made and the iron, the metal that touches the fabric, is super thin.
reviews.reviewText: I think the wire that plugs into the wall is actually more valuable than the iron itself. It doesn't get hot enough to actually do the job. It is so light. weight that it rolls over when you set it down. The thin metal on the bottom makes it so there's only a spot in the middle that actually gets hot. The rest is medium hottemperature.
Tamaño ideal, cómodo y económico. Llegó antes de la fecha, buen servicio de parte de todos. Gracias.
The iron is a perfect fit for small jobs It takes awhile to heat up, but once heated it's great. Small, compact and light.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on May 15, 2017
reviews.reviewText: Although it needed an adaptor for the plug it was easy to get at a large DIY store and the iron is super.

reviews.reviewTitle: Cute and small but not hot
reviews.reviewText: Cute and small but doesnt heat up enough for picture transfers i found
Es muy buena y realmente calienta, lo único malo es que al momento de planchar el cable estorba un poco y apoyar tu mano es un poco incomodo, aun así entiendo esto por el tamaño del producto.
